intro: Bromus commutatus var. villosus, commonly known as hairy false brome, is a perennial grass species native to western North America. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and dense,丛生的 foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riparian areas. Its leaves are covered in fine, hairy pubescence, which distinguishes it from other similar grasses. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brownish flowers.
